results.title: Search for oil
results.brief_description: ‘Search for oil’ explains some of the work involved in oil exploration prior to drilling wells. The technology is becoming increasingly complex as the search becomes more difficult, but the story is told in a simple way using interesting images from around the world with basic non-technical animated drawings. It incorporates examples of the latest advances in the field of seismic exploration.

results.title: Search for identity
results.brief_description: Presents the history of a former Cobb and Co coach house on the Old Sydney Road at Avenel in Central Victoria, from its early days in the 1850s to the present. Explores methods of research showing various techniques used to reconstruct the building’s history: visits to the Central Plans Office, Titles Office and Avenel Cemetery; and an examination of the building’s structure. Narrated bhy John Stanton.

results.title: Search for a link
results.brief_description: A documentary that examines the hypothesis that the human mind can influence the body’s defences. Experts are now testing to see if there is a link between certain personalities and the susceptibility to cancer. Researchers, in this field, discuss their experiments, and whether there is such a thing as a “cancer personality”.

results.title: Search and research: an impression of the building research establishment
results.creator_credit: Rayant Pictures, John Durst and Tom Williamson
results.brief_description: Shows the work of the Building Research Establishment, which provides a technical advisory service for the construction industry both in the U.K. and overseas. Shows some of the Establishment’s projects, including the detailed study of building materials, research into the environmental aspects of the growth of new towns, and the study of resources to improve the utilisation of building materials and labour.

results.title: Search and privacy
results.brief_description: Presents realistic contemporary situations to illustrate the problems surrounding the conflict between efficient law enforcement and the right of the individual to be free from unreasonable searches and invasion of privacy. Illustrations are related to the Fourth Amendment of the American Bill of Rights. Made for discussion purposes. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Sealsong (D)
results.creator_credit: Mobius Productions, International Fund for Animal Welfare and Stephen Best
results.brief_description: Shows the annual migration of the harp seals to the coast of Newfoundland, where they await the birth of their white pups which are subsequnetly brutally slaughtered for their fur by seal hunters. Each year Brian Davies of the International Fund for Animal Welfare comes to the sea nureries in his fight to save the seals. In this film he makes a strong plea for their preservation. Narrated by Jack Lord and Brian Davies. Restricted: postprimary schools only. WARNING - MAY CONTAIN DISTURBING IMAGES.

results.title: Seachange = Sea change. Series 3. Ep. 8-13
results.brief_description: Series 3, episodes 8-13. “I Name thee bay of pearls” (Dir: Stuart McDonald); Laura’s mother arrives in Pearl Bay but Laura has little time for her or her grievances, Max begins learning about Pearl Bay history and Harold is feeling his age, especially when he finds himself representing elderly drivers caught in a recent spate of traffic crimes. “Eminent persons” (Dir: Ben Lewin); Laura discovers a case of report card fraud involving Rupert, corrupt Port Deakin councillors are brought to trial - giving Max the chance to stir things up a bit, and Heather leaves Bob after he refuses to support her success at winning a prestigious real estate award. “Checks and balances” (Dir: Ben Lewin); Something is wrong with Kevin, he’s not talking, goes out of town without Phrani, and has even made it out of shorts into slacks. Meanwhile, Laura is reluctant to spread news of her impending marriage and is perturbed by her reaction to Max when he repays a debt. Max is also alienated by the town when they discover he wrote ‘Still waters’. “Love in the time of Coleridge” (Dir: Ian Watson); Max accepts a lucrative job at an international newspaper and plans to leave Pearl Bay, Trudi becomes a Vietnamese interpreter in court and Karen takes up surfing in an attempt to win back Angus. “To thine own self be true” (Dir: Ian Watson); Laura decides to tell Warwick about her night with Max, who also feels compelled to tell him about his true feelings for Laura. Meanwhile, Max discovers a plan to turn Pearl Bay into a nuclear waste dump. “Half life” (Dir: Ian Watson); Laura is suffering from the effects of a cancelled wedding, Meredith suffers a stroke which has amazing repercussions for the rest of the town and Karen and Angus have their dream wedding. Guest stars include Shaun Micallef and Mark Mitchell.
